@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Mixin for the border radius CSS property. This mixin is usually used by {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}. Keep in mind that this is not supported by all browsers:

  • Firefox 3,5+
  • IE9+
  • Safari 3.0+
  • Opera 10.5+
  • Chrome 4.0+

@description.name: @description
@description.body: top left corner radius

@description.name: @description
@description.body: top right corner radius

@description.name: @description
@description.body: bottom left corner radius

@description.name: @description
@description.body: bottom right corner radius

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group to set the corner radius of all sides

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Takes a styles map and adds the border radius styles in place to the given map. This is the needed behavior for {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: styles {Map} A map to add the styles.
@param.description: A map to add the styles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property radiusTopLeft. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #radiusTopLeft}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property radiusTopLeft. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #radiusTopLeft}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property radiusTopLeft. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #radiusTopLeft}.
